byline.contributor: Mohamed Ibrahim contributed reporting from Mogadishu, Somalia.

abstract: Kenyan officials make surprise visit to Somalia in effort to assure weak government there that Kenya harbors no intentions to occupy Somalia, despite sending hundreds of troops across border to fight militant Islamist group Shabab.
snippet: Kenya sought to reassure Somalia that it was not harboring intentions to occupy its territory, despite sending hundreds of troops across the border over the weekend.
lead_paragraph: Kenya sought to reassure Somalia that it was not harboring intentions to occupy its territory, despite sending hundreds of troops across the border over the weekend.

headline.main: Following Troops, Kenyan Officials Go to Somalia
headline.print_headline: Following Troops, Kenyan Officials Go to Somalia
headline.seo: Kenyan Officials, After Troops, Make Surprise Somalia Visit
